title.text: Transferring NLP models across languages and domains

abstractContent.text: How can we build Natural Language Processing models for new domains and new languages?

In this talk I will survey some recent advances to address this ubiquitous challenge, from cross-lingual transfer to learning models under distant supervision from disparate sources, multitask-learning and data selection.

include learning under sample selection bias (domain adaptation , transfer learning), learning from beyond the text and multimodal inputs, and in general learning under limited supervision for cross-domain and cross-lingual NLP, applied to a range of applications from author profiling, syntactic language understanding, information extraction and visual question answering.
Barbara is member of the advisory board of the EACL (European Association for Computational Linguistics) and publicity director of the Association for Computational Linguistics.
